title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 23 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 23.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23:1, when you sit to eat with a ruler, what should you do?
options: Consider diligently what is before thee
questions.correctAnswer: Consider diligently what is before thee
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:1 instructs to consider diligently what is before you when sitting to eat with a ruler.

questions.question: What warning is given in Proverbs 23:2 to a man given to appetite?
options: Put a knife to thy throat
questions.correctAnswer: Put a knife to thy throat
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:2 says to put a knife to your throat if you are a man given to appetite, warning against uncontrolled desire.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Proverbs 23:4: 'Labour not to be ______: cease from thine own wisdom.'
questions.correctAnswer: rich
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:4 advises not to labour to be rich and to cease from your own wisdom.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23:5, riches are compared to what?
options: Wings that fly away as an eagle toward heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Wings that fly away as an eagle toward heaven
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:5 compares riches to wings that fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 23:7 says 'As he thinketh in his heart, so is he.'
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:7 states 'For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he.'

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23:9 advise about speaking to a fool?
options: Speak not in the ears of a fool
questions.correctAnswer: Speak not in the ears of a fool
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:9 warns against speaking in the ears of a fool because he will despise wisdom.

questions.question: Who is described as mighty and will plead the cause of the fatherless in Proverbs 23:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Their redeemer
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:11 states that their redeemer is mighty and shall plead their cause.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 23:13 says that if you beat a child with the rod, he shall die.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:13 says the child shall not die if beaten with the rod.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23:15, what will happen if the son’s heart is wise?
options: The son will be honored by kings
The son will become a ruler
questions.correctAnswer: The father’s heart shall rejoice
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:15 says the father’s heart will rejoice if the son’s heart is wise.

questions.question: What should one not let their heart do according to Proverbs 23:17?
questions.correctAnswer: Envy sinners
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:17 advises not to let your heart envy sinners.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 23:20 warns against being among riotous eaters of flesh.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:20 warns not to be among winebibbers or riotous eaters of flesh.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23:22, what should you not despise?
options: Thy mother when she is old
questions.correctAnswer: Thy mother when she is old
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:22 instructs not to despise your mother when she is old.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23:23 instruct you to buy and not sell?
questions.correctAnswer: Truth, wisdom, instruction, and understanding
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:23 tells us to buy truth, wisdom, instruction, and understanding and not sell them.

questions.question: Who shall greatly rejoice according to Proverbs 23:24?
questions.correctAnswer: The father of the righteous
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:24 states that the father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice.

questions.question: What is described as a deep ditch and a narrow pit in Proverbs 23:27?
options: A whore and a strange woman
questions.correctAnswer: A whore and a strange woman
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:27 describes a whore as a deep ditch and a strange woman as a narrow pit.

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 23 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with greed and the desire to be rich quickly. Based on Proverbs 23, what biblical truth would you share about wealth?
options: Labour not to be rich; riches fly away like an eagle
Seek wealth by any means necessary
Trust in your own wisdom to gain riches
Ignore the fleeting nature of money
questions.correctAnswer: Labour not to be rich; riches fly away like an eagle
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:4-5 teaches us not to labor to be rich or rely on our own wisdom because riches are fleeting and can disappear quickly like an eagle flying towards heaven. This warns against greed and trusting in wealth.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 23 advise us to handle correction and discipline in parenting?
options: Beat the child with the rod to save his soul from hell
Discipline only when necessary and lightly
questions.correctAnswer: Beat the child with the rod to save his soul from hell
questions.explanation: Verses 13-14 emphasize the importance of correction in parenting. The rod symbolizes discipline that preserves the child's life and soul, showing that loving correction is vital for their spiritual well-being.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23, what attitude should a believer have toward sinners and their lifestyle?
options: Let not your heart envy sinners but fear the LORD
Join sinners to enjoy life fully
Ignore the fear of the LORD
Envy sinners for their apparent success
questions.correctAnswer: Let not your heart envy sinners but fear the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:17 teaches believers to avoid envying sinners and instead maintain reverence and fear of the LORD continually, highlighting the importance of spiritual focus over worldly envy.

questions.question: A believer wonders how to gain wisdom and understanding. What counsel does Proverbs 23 offer?
options: Buy truth, wisdom, instruction, and understanding and do not sell them
Ignore wisdom and follow your heart
Rely on others to teach you without personal effort
questions.correctAnswer: Buy truth, wisdom, instruction, and understanding and do not sell them
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:23 encourages investing in spiritual truths and wisdom as valuable treasures that should be held onto and not discarded, emphasizing the importance of actively pursuing godly knowledge.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23 warn about associating with certain kinds of people, especially regarding drinking and eating habits?
options: Avoid winebibbers and riotous eaters of flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid winebibbers and riotous eaters of flesh
questions.explanation: Verses 20-21 warn against being among those who overindulge in wine and food, as drunkenness and gluttony lead to poverty and shame, teaching self-control and wise companionship.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 23 describe the behavior of someone with an evil eye who invites you to eat?
options: He says eat and drink but his heart is not with you
He does not care about your presence
questions.correctAnswer: He says eat and drink but his heart is not with you
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:6-7 explains that one with an evil eye may invite you to eat and drink, but inwardly he harbors ill will or selfish motives, teaching caution in accepting such invitations.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 23 encourages speaking wisdom to fools because they will appreciate and understand it.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:9 advises against speaking wisdom to fools because they will despise and reject wise words, showing prudence in sharing counsel.

questions.question: What is the biblical principle in Proverbs 23 about honoring parents?
options: Hearken unto thy father and despise not thy mother when she is old
Ignore your parents in old age
Honor parents only if they provide for you
questions.correctAnswer: Hearken unto thy father and despise not thy mother when she is old
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:22 promotes respect and honor for both father and mother even in their old age, highlighting the biblical command for lifelong honor and care.

questions.question: A believer is tempted by the allure of rich food and drink at a ruler’s table. What practical advice does Proverbs 23 give?
options: Do not desire his dainties because they are deceitful meat
Eat as much as you can to enjoy the feast
Trust that the food is wholesome
Ignore the ruler’s food and bring your own
questions.correctAnswer: Do not desire his dainties because they are deceitful meat
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:3 warns that the delicacies of a ruler may be deceptive, teaching the believer to be cautious about craving what may not be spiritually or morally safe.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'My son, give me thine ______, and let thine eyes observe my ways.'
questions.correctAnswer: heart
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:26 calls for heartfelt devotion and attentiveness to godly guidance, illustrating the importance of sincere commitment.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23 say about the consequences of lingering long over wine?
options: It leads to woe, sorrow, contentions, and wounds without cause
questions.correctAnswer: It leads to woe, sorrow, contentions, and wounds without cause
questions.explanation: Verses 29-30 describe the negative effects of excessive drinking, including various troubles and strife, teaching about the dangers of overindulgence.

questions.question: How should a believer respond to the enticement of a 'strange woman' or immoral temptation according to Proverbs 23?
options: Avoid her because she is a deep ditch and narrow pit
Ignore her because she is harmless
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid her because she is a deep ditch and narrow pit
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:27 warns that immoral women are like dangerous traps, increasing transgressors, teaching believers to flee from temptation to preserve purity.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23 say about trusting in your own wisdom for gaining riches?
options: Cease from your own wisdom because it does not guarantee riches
Rely fully on your wisdom for success
questions.correctAnswer: Cease from your own wisdom because it does not guarantee riches
questions.explanation: Verse 4 cautions against relying on personal wisdom alone to gain wealth, teaching humility and trust in God rather than self-reliance.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 23 teaches that a father greatly rejoices when his child is righteous and wise.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:24-25 clearly states that the father of a righteous and wise child rejoices greatly, emphasizing the blessing of godly offspring.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23, what happens to the morsel eaten from a man with an evil eye?
options: Thou shalt vomit it up and lose thy sweet words
questions.correctAnswer: Thou shalt vomit it up and lose thy sweet words
questions.explanation: Verse 8 warns that eating from a stingy or envious person results in regret and loss of goodwill, teaching caution in accepting their hospitality.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 23.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23:5, what metaphor is used to describe the fleeting nature of riches?
options: They fly away as an eagle toward heaven
They melt like snow in the sun
They vanish like smoke in the wind
They sink like a stone in the sea
questions.correctAnswer: They fly away as an eagle toward heaven
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:5 uses the metaphor of riches taking wings and flying away like an eagle to illustrate their transient and unreliable nature.

questions.question: What is the primary warning given in Proverbs 23:2 to those with a strong appetite?
options: Put a knife to thy throat
questions.correctAnswer: Put a knife to thy throat
questions.explanation: Verse 2 metaphorically advises self-control for those prone to excess by saying 'put a knife to thy throat,' indicating the need for strict restraint.

questions.question: Which literary device is prominently used in Proverbs 23:7, where it states, 'For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he'?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: This verse exemplifies Hebrew parallelism by presenting a cause-effect relationship between thought and identity, a common poetic structure in Proverbs.

questions.question: Proverbs 23:12 encourages applying one's heart to what?
questions.correctAnswer: Instruction
questions.explanation: The verse advises dedicating oneself to learning and knowledge, highlighting the value of wisdom over material gain.

questions.question: In Proverbs 23:13-14, what is the purpose of 'beating the child with the rod' according to the text?
options: To deliver his soul from hell
questions.correctAnswer: To deliver his soul from hell
questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes corrective discipline as a means of moral and spiritual preservation, showing the cultural value of child-rearing discipline.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23:10 warn against in terms of land and property?
questions.correctAnswer: Removing the old landmark
questions.explanation: This refers to the ancient practice of boundary markers; removing them was a metaphor for injustice, especially against orphans.

questions.question: Who is described as 'mighty' and will plead the cause of the fatherless in Proverbs 23:11?
questions.correctAnswer: Their Redeemer
questions.explanation: The term 'Redeemer' here can be understood as a protector or advocate, indicating divine or legal protection for the vulnerable.

questions.question: Proverbs 23:17 advises not to let what emotion dominate your heart?
questions.correctAnswer: Envy of sinners
questions.explanation: This verse instructs to avoid envy, promoting reverence for the LORD as a continuous attitude.

questions.question: What is the consequence described in Proverbs 23:21 for the drunkard and the glutton?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall come to poverty
questions.explanation: This verse links overindulgence in food and drink with inevitable ruin, reflecting moral and social consequences.

questions.question: Proverbs 23:23 exhorts to 'buy the truth' and not to sell it. What else is paired with truth in this verse?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom, instruction, and understanding
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes the priceless nature of spiritual and intellectual virtues over material wealth.

questions.question: The warning in Proverbs 23:27-28 uses which two metaphors to describe a 'strange woman'?
options: A deep ditch and a narrow pit
A raging fire and a wild beast
A thorn bush and a desert
A roaring lion and a serpent
questions.correctAnswer: A deep ditch and a narrow pit
questions.explanation: These metaphors illustrate the danger and entrapment associated with immoral behavior, common in ancient Near Eastern wisdom literature.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23:31-32, what is the ultimate effect of wine described as?
options: It biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder
questions.correctAnswer: It biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder
questions.explanation: The imagery contrasts the initial allure of wine with its harmful consequences, symbolizing deception and danger.

questions.question: What advice is given in Proverbs 23:9 about speaking to fools?
options: Speak not in the ears of a fool
questions.correctAnswer: Speak not in the ears of a fool
questions.explanation: The verse advises against wasting wisdom on those unwilling or unable to appreciate it, reflecting a pragmatic approach to communication.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 23:26 calls for a son to give his heart and observe the ways of the speaker.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 26 explicitly says, 'My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways,' indicating a call to attentive obedience.

questions.question: Proverbs 23:16 expresses joy in response to what kind of speech?
options: When thy lips speak right things
When thy lips praise the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: When thy lips speak right things
questions.explanation: This verse rejoices specifically at the righteous and wise speech of the son, reflecting the value of moral integrity.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 23 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 23 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 23, what is the wise attitude toward wealth and riches?
options: Labour not to be rich and cease from thine own wisdom
Seek wealth diligently to secure your future
Trust in riches as a sure foundation
Use riches to gain honor among men
questions.correctAnswer: Labour not to be rich and cease from thine own wisdom
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:4 advises against laboring to be rich and relying on one's own wisdom, highlighting the fleeting nature of wealth. This is consistent with Ecclesiastes 5:10 which warns that the love of money is never satisfied, 1 Timothy 6:9-10 that cautions about the dangers of desiring riches, Matthew 6:19-21 where Jesus teaches not to lay up treasures on earth, and James 5:1-3 which warns of the judgment on the rich who hoard wealth.

questions.question: What does the chapter say about eating with a ruler and the attitude one should have?
options: Consider diligently what is before thee
Ignore what is set before you
questions.correctAnswer: Consider diligently what is before thee
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:1 instructs one to consider carefully what is before them when eating with a ruler, implying wisdom and prudence. This aligns with Proverbs 4:7 which values wisdom above all, James 1:5 encouraging believers to seek wisdom from God, Luke 14:7-11 teaching humility at the table, and Romans 12:3 about sober judgment.

questions.question: What warning does Proverbs 23 give about desiring the dainties of a ruler?
options: They nourish the body and soul
questions.correctAnswer: They are deceitful meat
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:3 warns against desiring the dainties of a ruler because they are deceitful, showing the danger of trusting in superficial pleasures. This is consistent with Psalm 34:8 valuing the fear of the Lord over worldly pleasures, Jeremiah 2:13 describing false sources of satisfaction, Matthew 4:4 emphasizing man shall not live by bread alone, and 1 John 2:15-17 warning against loving the world.

questions.question: Why should one not eat the bread of him that hath an evil eye, according to Proverbs 23?
options: Because his heart is not with thee
questions.correctAnswer: Because his heart is not with thee
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:6-7 describes that a person with an evil eye invites you to eat and drink but their heart is not truly with you, indicating deceit and selfishness. This resonates with Matthew 23:27 where hypocrisy is condemned, Psalm 55:21 warning of deceitful friends, Luke 6:45 teaching that the heart's condition determines actions, and James 3:14-16 about bitter envy and selfish ambition.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23:10-11 teach about respecting boundaries and defending the fatherless?
options: Remove not the old landmark; their redeemer is mighty
Take advantage of the fatherless for gain
questions.correctAnswer: Remove not the old landmark; their redeemer is mighty
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:10-11 teaches not to move ancient boundaries, especially those of the fatherless, because their Redeemer (God) is mighty and will plead their cause. This relates to Deuteronomy 27:17 condemning moving landmarks, Psalm 68:5 describing God as a father of the fatherless, Isaiah 1:17 calling to defend the fatherless, and James 1:27 about pure religion caring for orphans.

questions.question: What is the purpose of correction from the rod as mentioned in Proverbs 23?
options: To deliver the child’s soul from hell
To punish harshly and cause pain
questions.correctAnswer: To deliver the child’s soul from hell
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:13-14 explains that correction with the rod is meant to save the child from spiritual ruin, a form of loving discipline. This is consistent with Hebrews 12:5-11 which speaks of God’s discipline as for our good, Ephesians 6:4 commanding fathers not to provoke but to bring up in the Lord’s discipline, Proverbs 19:18 on disciplining a child, and Revelation 3:19 where Jesus disciplines those He loves.

questions.question: What attitude toward sinners does Proverbs 23:17 encourage?
options: Let not thine heart envy sinners but fear the LORD
Ignore the fear of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Let not thine heart envy sinners but fear the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:17 urges believers not to envy sinners but to maintain the fear of the LORD always. This aligns with Psalm 37:1-2 advising not to fret because of evildoers, Ecclesiastes 7:18 valuing the fear of God over envy, Romans 12:14-21 calling for blessing and not cursing enemies, and 1 Peter 3:14 encouraging reverent fear rather than envy.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23:23 mean by 'Buy the truth, and sell it not'?
options: Value truth and wisdom above all and never forsake them
questions.correctAnswer: Value truth and wisdom above all and never forsake them
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:23 exhorts to acquire truth, wisdom, instruction, and understanding and never to let them go, underscoring their supreme worth. This is echoed in Proverbs 4:7 valuing wisdom, Psalm 19:7 extolling God's law as perfect, John 8:32 where Jesus says truth sets free, and 2 Timothy 3:16 emphasizing Scripture's role in teaching and correction.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 23:26 describe the proper response to parental guidance?
options: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways
questions.correctAnswer: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:26 calls for wholehearted devotion and attentiveness to parental guidance, reflecting the biblical theme of honoring parents (Exodus 20:12, Ephesians 6:1-3), and aligning with Psalm 119:15 about meditating on God's ways, and Colossians 3:20 about obeying parents in the Lord.

questions.question: What imagery does Proverbs 23:27-28 use to warn against immoral women, and what is the implication?
options: A whore is a deep ditch and a strange woman a narrow pit, lying in wait for prey
A whore is a shining light and a strange woman a fountain of life
A whore is a tree of righteousness
A whore is a gentle breeze
questions.correctAnswer: A whore is a deep ditch and a strange woman a narrow pit, lying in wait for prey
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:27-28 uses the imagery of a deep ditch and narrow pit to depict the dangerous and ensnaring nature of immoral women, emphasizing the spiritual peril involved. This imagery aligns with Proverbs 5:3-14 warning against adultery, Hosea 2:5 depicting unfaithfulness as a trap, 1 Corinthians 6:18 calling to flee sexual immorality, and Jude 1:12-13 describing false teachers as hidden reefs.

questions.question: What are the consequences of excessive drinking as described in Proverbs 23:29-35?
options: Woe, sorrow, contentions, wounds without cause, redness of eyes
questions.correctAnswer: Woe, sorrow, contentions, wounds without cause, redness of eyes
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:29-35 outlines the negative effects of drunkenness including woe, sorrow, and physical harm. This is consistent with Ephesians 5:18 warning against drunkenness, Galatians 5:19-21 listing drunkenness as a work of the flesh, Isaiah 5:11-12 describing woes to those who rise early to seek strong drink, and 1 Corinthians 6:10 warning drunkards will not inherit the kingdom.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23:12 instruct about the heart and ears?
options: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge
Trust only in your own understanding
questions.correctAnswer: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:12 calls for a receptive heart and attentive ears toward instruction and knowledge, reflecting the biblical emphasis on pursuing wisdom (Proverbs 2:2, Psalm 34:11, James 1:19, and Isaiah 1:18). This openness leads to understanding and right living.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 23 say about speaking to fools?
options: Speak not in the ears of a fool, for he will despise the wisdom of thy words
Speak wisdom to fools to enlighten them
Fools will always respect wise words
questions.correctAnswer: Speak not in the ears of a fool, for he will despise the wisdom of thy words
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:9 warns that speaking wisdom to a fool is often fruitless as they despise it, paralleling Ecclesiastes 10:14 about fools' folly, Matthew 7:6 warning not to cast pearls before swine, Proverbs 26:4-5 about the futility and paradox of answering fools, and 2 Timothy 2:23 instructing to avoid foolish and ignorant disputes.

questions.question: What joy does the father experience when his child is wise, according to Proverbs 23?
options: Great rejoicing in heart and reins
questions.correctAnswer: Great rejoicing in heart and reins
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:15-16 expresses the deep joy a father feels when his child is wise, rejoicing even in his inward parts. This is consistent with Psalm 127:3-5 describing children as a heritage from the Lord, Ephesians 6:4 about fathers bringing up children in the Lord's discipline, Luke 15:20 where the father rejoices over the prodigal, and Proverbs 10:1 highlighting a wise son as a father's delight.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 23:20-21 describe those who associate with excessive drinkers and gluttons?
options: They shall come to poverty and wear rags
They shall gain wealth and honor
They shall live long and prosper
questions.correctAnswer: They shall come to poverty and wear rags
questions.explanation: Proverbs 23:20-21 warns that those who keep company with drunkards and gluttons will face poverty and destitution, paralleling Galatians 5:21 listing drunkenness among works of the flesh, 1 Corinthians 6:10 warning drunkards will not inherit the kingdom, Isaiah 28:7 describing leaders who are heavy drinkers, and Romans 13:13 exhorting to live properly and soberly.
